title: Nasus buffs were too much
body:
I understand you wanted Nasus to be better but you have to look over him and nerf some parts of his kit if you want him to have the 50% CD on his Q with R. For instance lower his slow or make it a skill shot not sure how you'd do that but he is suppose to have a weakness in being kited I would understand a slow would be needed to give him some form of a way to get close to his target but his current slow is way to much for Nasus to have. His Passive is not healthy I understand he needs sustain but maybe make it so you have to hit minions with your Q or hit champions with Q like Yorick this not only enforces stacking but its also healthy instead of just auto attacking minions. His resistances late game are way to powerful with his passive possibly lowering the ability would make him easier to play against late game. And lastly his Q is pretty unhealthy to the game stacking in general is unhealthy sure its unique and what not but its just not healthy maybe make it take longer to stack or just remove the stacking and just give him increased damage on his Q.

This is just my opinion obviously there are gonna be some Nasus mains or just people to flame me for thinking Nasus is in a bad state as a champion but hes just way to unhealthy to the game.

Yes, there is a very toxic and negative aspect to "If I farm I can just win out the game." as a playstyle, and hence why Nasus has seen very few changes and buffs over time.  You don't want champions that require lots of focus to stop from dominating the game to be too powerful.  The difference between an adc and a champion like Nasus is that Nasus is incredibly hard to kill, and the only form of counterplay to his kit is kite him out, which works fine if you're ahead but not if you are behind.

ADC's have lots of counterplay, including zone control, cc, or just kill them.  It's easy to say kill an adc, because they lack the kind of damage mitigation tools that are available to other champions if they want to have any kind of impact on the game.  It's less viable to try and kill a Nasus, considering his ult.

i really wish we had some check up for boards so that only people with a minimum of let's say 90 IQ points are allowed to talk here. 
The amount of "BUT TEH WINRATE HURR DURR!" on these boards reached cancerous levels without any actual arguments what so ever. 
Statistics CAN back up someones argumentation but just throwing around some numbers as facts for your argumentation does not work.

Well let's see there's a couple of reason why his win rate reflects his performance 

- Takes too long to scale, especially with most games ending 30 mins
- Vulnerable to early ganks with no mobility 
- Easily kited
- You can wait out his ult if he used his W incorrectly
- Can't 5v5 effectively and never will 
- His sustain is garbage an can be easily negated with an executioners, thus having no sustain
- Gets denied too hard by any early game bully
- His passive laning makes scaling laners an option
-  Fiora still exists 

Maybe the boards will allow people to post with 90 IQ and above because win rate is a reflection of what a champions performance can do, but I guess some people IQ is simply too low to understand.

So a few counterpoints:

-  When games start taking longer his winrate rises quite a bit.  I don't appreciate a champion whose winrate and performance is entirely tied to game length rather than overall performance.

-  Several other champions are low mobility and vulnerable to ganks, it is a built in delay to him, but that still makes his gameplay unhealthy.

-  Um, sort of but not always.  Nasus strength comes from being able to take towers at alarming rates and requiring focus to deal with him.  Wither is incredibly powerful, so a single champion isn't going to be able to kite him effectively unless they are built entirely for kiting or they are much stronger than him at that point in the game.

-  So, if someone misplays heavily you can counter them?  That's innately true of any champion, it's not unique to Nasus nor does it address his unhealthy infinite scaling playstyle.

-  I disagree heavily on the viability of a 5v5 Nasus, because a lock down comp with Sejuani can definitely allow Nasus the power to dominate in fights.  Actually just Sejuani is really powerful with a Nasus (or any melee champion for that matter).  It is the tank meta for junglers atm anyway.

-  His sustain isn't garbage if it requires an item to counter it, but there is certainly a built in counter to lifesteal based effects in the form of GW that I wish more people used.  In all the games I have played that the enemy is using a heavy healing comp, Soraka, Vlad, etc I'm usually the one buying it as the jungler later in the game because the lanes just ignored it and got wrecked.  This is one of the points I agree with.

-  Again, being denied is just a delay to his unhealthy style of gameplay and doesn't address the issues here.  It's not that Nasus is too powerful, it's that he's just bad design.  Feast or Famine style champions are not very intuitive to begin with and for a game that prides itself on options having something be very arbitrary like Nasus is not good.  It comes down to are the other lanes winning, and is Nasus farming.  Because the other aspects of the game just don't seem to apply in Nasus games.

Like, I get that you are trying to explain why he's not got a high winrate, but you aren't addressing the issues with his kit that players have.  I personally hate Nasus, both playing as him and playing against him.  It's not a fun feeling, there's not a lot of choices, there's just "Do this one thing, end the game, or you lose to his q."  The previous thing about Nasus was that he was entirely split push so you could kind of try ignoring him and rushing down teamfights and pressuring harder than he was, but with his ultimate changes he can become a teamfight monster, bursting anyone in range down.  And with the amount of lockdown in the game now it's very easy for a couple q hits to completely swing a fight.  Nasus is the kind of champion you DON'T want having a decent or viable winrate, a relic of the past.

Nasus is meant to be feast or famine because if he's ahead he'll stay ahead and if he falls behind then he'll have a hard time coming back because he revolves around getting farm. 

The reason I'm not "addressing" his issues is because he's fine in his current kit and already has an abundant amount of counter play.
I mean, that's your opinion that a feast and famine playstyle is fine for the game.  It's my opinion and apparently several others that it's not.  Go figure.
So you want Nasus to be strong at all stages of the game... lol. His feast of famine style is what keeps him at bay in the early game.

I want him to be reworked instead of buffed up.  Though reworks are inherently hit or miss usually themselves.  I'd rather the unhealthy playstyle that he has which keeps him in this spot were changed rather than them just trying to poke buffs at a champion that can easily become problematic as a design strategy.

His design isn't problematic which I've been explaining to you but I'm just going to stop here cause I'm clearly beating a dead horse especially after this comment.
